intro: Sofianthe sibirica, commonly known as Siberian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the cold climates of Siberia and northern Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes many species of bellflowers. The plant features showy, bell-shaped blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Sofianthe sibirica is valued for its ornamental appeal and adaptability to temperate gardens.
